init_state.contents: Solve the math problem in small steps.A triangle has a side of length 6 cm, a side of length 8 cm and a right angle. What is the shortest possible length of the remaining side of the triangle? Express your answer in centimeters as a decimal to the nearest hundredth.

children.contents: The third side is calculated as √(8² - 6²) = √28 ≈ 5.29 cm. The state of the world is that the shortest possible length of the remaining side is 5.29 cm.
children.original_response:
Calculate the length of the third side using the Pythagorean theorem when the given sides are a leg and the hypotenuse, then round to the nearest hundredth. 

The next action is to compute √(8² - 6²) = √(64 - 36) = √28 ≈ 5.29 cm. 

[FINISHED]
